intro: Arthrosolen, commonly known as the rock fern, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its unique, often clustered growth habit and its ability to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. The plant typically has small, delicate leaves and produces clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. Arthrosolen species are often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where they contribute to the biodiversity of their ecosystems. Their botanical features make them interesting subjects for both horticultural and ecological studies.
